description: Concerning membership on the correctional industries advisory committee.

status.text: Rules Committee relieved of further consideration.  Placed on second reading.

original.text:
H-0380.2
HOUSE BILL 1185
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Fosse, Farivar, Simmons, Wylie, and Salahuddin
Prefiled 01/07/25.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Community Safety.
AN ACT Relating to membership on the correctional industries advisory committee; and amending RCW 72.09.080.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 72.09.080 and 2011 1st sp.s. c 21 s 40 are each amended to read as follows:
(1) The correctional industries advisory committee shall consist of 11 voting members in total, with nine of the voting members((,)) appointed by the secretary and two of the voting members appointed by the governor. Each member shall serve a three-year staggered term. The speaker of the house of representatives and the president of the senate shall each appoint one member from each of the two largest caucuses in their respective houses. The legislators so appointed shall be nonvoting members and shall serve two-year terms, or until they cease to be members of the house from which they were appointed, whichever occurs first. The nine members appointed by the secretary shall include three representatives from labor, three representatives from business representing cross sections of industries and all sizes of employers, and three members from the general public. The two voting members appointed by the governor must be individuals from underrepresented populations who have direct lived experience as those terms are defined in RCW 43.18A.010.
(2) The committee shall elect a chair and such other officers as it deems appropriate from among the voting members.
(3) The voting members of the committee shall serve with compensation pursuant to RCW 43.03.240 and shall be reimbursed by the department for travel expenses and per diem under RCW 43.03.050 and 43.03.060, as now or hereafter amended. Legislative members shall be reimbursed under RCW 44.04.120, as now or hereafter amended.
(4) The secretary shall provide such staff services, facilities, and equipment as the board shall require to carry out its duties.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of this bill is to amend the membership criteria of the correctional industries advisory committee in Washington State. The main change involves the appointment of two voting members by the governor, specifically requiring these members to come from underrepresented populations and possess direct lived experience. This aims to enhance diversity and representation within the committee.

Key Provisions

Committee Membership

  • The correctional industries advisory committee will consist of 11 voting members in total.
  • Voting Members:
    • Nine members will be appointed by the secretary.
    • Two members will be appointed by the governor, who must be individuals from underrepresented populations with direct lived experience.
  • Non-voting Members:
    • The speaker of the house and the president of the senate will each appoint one non-voting member from the two largest caucuses in their respective houses.

Terms of Service

  • Each voting member will serve a three-year staggered term.
  • Non-voting legislative members will serve two-year terms or until they are no longer members of their respective houses.

Composition of Voting Members

  • The nine members appointed by the secretary will include:
    • Three representatives from labor.
    • Three representatives from business, representing various industries and employer sizes.
    • Three members from the general public.

Compensation and Reimbursement

  • Voting members will receive compensation and will be reimbursed for travel expenses and per diem according to specified RCW codes.
  • Legislative members will be reimbursed under a different RCW code.

Staffing

  • The secretary will provide necessary staff services, facilities, and equipment to support the committee in fulfilling its duties.
